comments: Called 4-abundant numbers. The first odd number is A119240(4) = 1853070540093840001956842537745897243375. - _T. D. Noe_, Mar 31 2011
references: Melvyn B. Nathanson, Elementary Methods in Number Theory, Springer, 2000, p 260.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: Select[Range[1000000], DivisorSigma[1, #] >= 4*#&] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Apr 21 2010 *)
author: _David W. Wilson_
